alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 10:38PM CDT until May 28 at 3:24AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas... Big Blue River near Blue Rapids affecting Marshall County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Blue River near Blue Rapids. * WHEN...From this evening to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs from Marysville to Tuttle Creek Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 25.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 30.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday night. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/top/.
